page.title: 01** S.HETTON AND HASWELL **
page.content: {************************************** The villages of S.Hetton and Haswell lie centrally in the N and S of the survey block which consists of residential,farming and industrial land in roughly equal proportions. The smaller village Haswell is the older dating back to the year 1338 whereas the larger S.Hetton only developed in the early 19th Century when the colliery was opened. Both villages are declining in terms of population, Haswell because of isolation from main routes and S.Hetton because of the closure of the colliery in 1982/83. The villages form two discrete units separated from one another and from surrounding urban areas by mixed agricultural land composed mainly of small farms. {**************************************
